anime.description: Sekkou Boys is a unit of four stone figures — the military saint and group leader Saint Giorgio, history`s original celebrity Medici, the strikingly handsome and multi-talented Hermes, and the god of war Mars who is earnest about love — who become idiosyncratic idols. The story depicts their efforts to make it in the entertainment world with their female manager Ishimoto Miki, who just graduated from college. Source: ANN

tag.name: idol
tag.description: In Japanese culture, idols (アイドル) are media personalities in their teens and early twenties who are considered particularly cute and cuddly and who will, for a period ranging from several months to a few years, regularly appear in the mass media, e.g. as singers for J-pop groups, bit-part actors, TV personalities, models in photo spreads published in magazines, advertisements, etc. Source: wiki

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: music
tag.description: Music anime generally revolves around people concerned with music in their everyday lives. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competitions, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal. This is not unlike the Sports category.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: Ultra Super Anime Time
tag.description: Ultra Super Anime Time was a half-hour anime block produced by http://anidb.net/cr30397 [Ultra Super Pictures] that aired on Tokyo MX and BS11 between July 2015 and June 2016. The block typically featured three http://anidb.net/t5852 [short episodes] anime of about eight minutes each.

episode.title: 私の芸術的人生の7年間を要約する現実的寓意
A Visceral Allegory of Seven Years of My Artistic Life
Watashi no Geijutsuteki Jinsei no 7 Nenkan o Youyaku Suru Genjitsuteki Guui
episode.summary: Arts school graduate Ishimoto Miki lands a job at Holbein Entertainment Inc., where she is assigned to be the Sekko Boys` manager. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 竜を退治する聖ゲオルギウス
St. Giorgius, Disposer of Dragons
Ryuu o Taiji Suru Sei Georgius
episode.summary: The Rockies land a meet-and-greet. Giorgio Giorgio-es his way through the event -- and that`s not entirely a good thing. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヌムール公ジュリアーノ・デ・メディチ
Giuliano de` Medici, Duke of Nemours
Nemours Kou Giuliano De Medici
episode.summary: The Rockies get involved in a drama! But only one of them has a part. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 我々はどこから来たのか, 我々は何者か, 我々はどこへ行くのか
Where Do We Come From? What Are We? Where Are We Going?
Wareware wa Doko kara Kita no ka, Wareware wa Nanimonoka, Wareware wa Doko e Iku no ka
episode.summary: Miki and the boys head to the TV studio for a singing show. There, they get a picture with idol Hanayashiki Mira, who turns out to be a huge fan. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 石膏アフタートーク第1話
Sekkou After Talk 1
音楽と分別の寓意
Allegory of Music and Prudence
Ongaku to Funbetsu no Guui
episode.summary: The Rockies have a gig at Music Studio, but they run short on time. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 内乱の予感
Civil War Brewing
Nairan no Yokan
episode.summary: Ishimoto and the Rockies attend a dinner show with their favorite idols, Dandy2Men. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: プリマヴェーラ
Primavera
Primavera
episode.summary: No one has an idea of what Hermes does during his downtime. As it turns out, he`s been screwing people. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: マルスから平和を守るミネルヴァ
Minerva Protecting Peace from Mars
Mars kara Heiwa o Mamoru Minerva
episode.summary: The Rockies are invited to an interview with the Furoyanagi "Comedian Killer" Setsuko. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最後の審判
The Last Judgment
Saigo no Shinban
episode.summary: Medici is abducted right before a huge event. Miki and the Rockies investigate. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 放蕩息子の帰宅
The Return of the Prodigal Son
Houtoumusuko no Kitaku
episode.summary: Insulted, Miki returns to her parents` place in Fukuoka. The Rockies panic. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 泣く女
The Weeping Woman
Naku Onna
episode.summary: The Rockies are in search of a new music producer. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ウルカヌスの鍛冶場
The Forge of Vulcan
Vulcanus no Kajiba
episode.summary: Mars pops out of a box and into a potential scandal. Source: crunchyroll
